channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Brain scientists are seeking weight-loss drugs without the nausea
item.description: Weight-loss drugs like Wegovy and Zepbound often cause nausea and other side effects. Brain scientists are looking for ways to solve this problem.

item.title: CDC claims vaccines may cause autism. And, Trump and Mamdani to meet today
item.description: The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he wil...

item.title: Can vaping help wean people off cigarettes? Anti-smoking advocates are sharply split
item.description: Many think it's a dangerous ploy by the tobacco industry. But some say, with millions of deaths each year attributed to smoking cigarettes, it's the l...

item.title: Are there lessons for the U.S. in this European country's struggle with measles?
item.description: In 2024, Romania, an upper middle income European country, had over 30,000 cases — putting it on the world's top ten measles list. Its vaccination rat...

item.title: This weekend, artists are speaking out across the country
item.description: Artists in more than 40 states are spending Friday and Saturday participating in the "Fall of Freedom" – which they say represents a creative resistan...

item.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine's allies coordinating in response to peace plan
item.description: "This must be a plan that ensures a real and dignified peace," Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said about the Trump administration's 28-point ...

item.title: Flash flooding overwhelms parts of Texas after powerful storm drops inches of rain
item.description: A powerful storm system slammed Texas on Thursday, causing flash flooding and dropping more than 10 inches of rain on some parts of Central Texas. Jas...

item.title: A Chicago street vendor couple has a defiant response to immigration arrests: Stick to the routine
item.description: Ofelia Herrera and Rafael Hernandez have refused to alter their routines as street food vendors during an immigration enforcement blitz in Chicago tha...

item.title: Rivals Washington Spirit and Gotham FC share game plans for NWSL title
item.description: Fans are ready for the final between rivals Washington Spirit and Gotham FC, the most played match of this season. Adriana Diaz has a preview of Satur...

item.title: The Dish: Couple's Vietnamese food truck draws long lines in San Jose
item.description: Chef-owners of San Jose's popular Het Say food truck, Hieu Le and his wife DuyAn, wanted to start the business to highlight food from South Vietnam's ...

item.title: UN climate summit drops mention of fossil fuels from draft deal
item.description: A row over fossil fuels has broken out at COP30 but this is also likely to be a negotiating tactic.

item.title: Pupils abducted from Catholic school in fresh Nigeria attack
item.description: Security forces have launched operations to assess the situation and locate the missing pupils.

item.title: Canadian man loses legal battle to reclaim million-dollar stash
item.description: Marcel Breton spent 16 years trying to reclaim C$1.2m police seized from hiding spots in his house.

item.title: Man prepares to finish walk around the world that took 27 years
item.description: Karl Bushby, a British man who has made it his mission to walk around the world, is about to finish the odyssey 27 years after it began. CBS News' Ram...

item.title: Russia yet to receive anything official from US on Ukraine peace plan, Kremlin says
item.description: The draft provisions come across as heavily slanted towards Moscow, but Volodymyr Zelensky says he is ready to work with the US.

item.title: South Africa calls gender violence a national disaster after protests
item.description: Fifteen women are killed every day in a country with one of the highest rates of gender violence in the world.

item.title: Dramatic photos of doomed UPS plane show the aircraft on fire and its engine flying off
Investigators say UPS plane that crashed in Kentucky, killing 14, had cracks in engine mount
